title: Facebook Goes Fishing for Likes From Wall Street
sub_head: The social-media company’s share slump makes it look like decent value, at least by comparison
body:
Social media is far from perfect, but it is a game—for better or for worse—that is won by comparison.
Facebook ’s shares rose nearly 2% on Monday after the company said its total revenue growth in the third quarter fell by more than 20 percentage points on a sequential basis due to Apple ’s recent changes to its iOS system which limit user tracking. The company’s forecast for total revenue growth from a year earlier in the fourth quarter was also about 7 percentage points shy of analyst estimates at the midpoint of the guidance range.
